briefTitle: Comparing Quetiapine XR Monotherapy and Augmentation With Lithium Augmentation in TRD Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Documented clinical diagnosis as confirmed by the M.I.N.I. meeting criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental disorders, 4th Edition (DSM-IV) for any of the following:296.2x MDD, Single Episode296.3x MDD, Recurrent Episode
* Current episode of depression present, at least 42 days prior to enrolment but not more than 18 months
* MADRS-Score ≥ 25 at enrolment and randomisation

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with a DSM-IV Axis I disorder other than MDD within 6 months of randomisation
* Patients with a diagnosis of DSM-IV Axis II disorder which has a major impact on the patient's current psychiatric status
* Patients who, in the investigator's judgment pose a current serious suicidal or homicidal risk, or have made a suicide attempt within the past 6 months

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Per Protocol Analysis Set)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Depressive Symptoms Between Randomisation and Week 6 Measured by Change in Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score (Modified Intention to Treat Analysis Set)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in LS mean total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score from randomisation to end-of-treatment (week 6) (Scale 0-60), lower score indicates a better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale MADRS ≤10, All Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients in remission, with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤10, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients in remission with one previous treatment failure and with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤10, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients in remission with two previous treatment failure and with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤10. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤8
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients in remission with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤8. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Depression Remission; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) ≤12
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients in remission with total Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) score ≤12. MADRS scale has range from 0 to 60, where the lower score indicates the better health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, All Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

outcomeMeasures.title: Response Rate; Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Score Reduced ≥ 50%, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Response rate at end of study measured as number of patients with Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) with total score reduction ≥ 50% compared to baseline, the higher number of patients the better

outcomeMeasures.title: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Item 2, All Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI)-I Item 2, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Responder: Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I) Item 2, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in global improvement measured by Clinical Global Impression Improvement (CGI-I). Scale from 1-4, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), All Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale form 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale from 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S), Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in severity of illness measured by Clinical Global Impression Scale (CGI-S). Scale from 1-7, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rating assessment of depressive symptoms using Beck Depression Inventory (BDI). Scale from 0-63, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Pain, Measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rating assessment of pain using a visual analogue scale (VAS). Scale from 0-100, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Anxiety Measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety using a visual analogue scale (VAS). Scale from 0-100, where a lower value shows a larger improvement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Anxiety Measured by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), State Anxiety Inventory
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety measured by STAI, state anxiety inventory (Scale 20-80, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Anxiety Measured by STAI, Trait Anxiety Inventory
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rating assessment of anxiety measured by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), trait anxiety inventory (Scale 20-80, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Sleep Quality Measured by Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), Item 4
outcomeMeasures.description: Sleeping quality measured by Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) item 4 (reduced sleep) (Scale 0-6, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Sleep Quality Measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Self-rated sleeping quality measured by PSQI (Scale 0-21, subscales 0-3, 18 questions, where a lower value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Short-form Health Survey (SF-36), Mental Component
outcomeMeasures.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using SF-36, mental component (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Short-form Health Survey (SF-36), Physical Component
outcomeMeasures.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using SF-36, physical component (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Quality of Life Measured by Health Questionnaire EQ-5D as Utility
outcomeMeasures.description: Self rating assessment of quality in life using EQ-5D utility (Scale 0-100, where a higher value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment: General Health (WPAI:GH)
outcomeMeasures.description: Self rating assessment of working productivity using WPAI:GH (Scale 0 to number of hours worked during a week multiplied with the salary in Euro, a lower value shows a larger improvement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, All Patients
outcomeMeasures.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm (225, 229 or 221).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, Patients With One Previous Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Item 4 Efficacy and Safety Combined, Patients With Two Previous Treatment Failures
outcomeMeasures.description: The physician has evaluated the therapeutic effect and the side effect combined at end of study. Patients with a 'marked/moderate' therapeutic effect and 'None/Do Not Significantly Interfere' side effect has been added. The higher values show more patients with a treatment effect without any side-effect. The range is from 0 patients to the maximum number of patients in the treatment arm.
